title: Sqlite error when no table alias set and class named used with locator->get()
body:
This is a (multiple allowed):

* [x] bug
* [x] enhancement

* CakePHP Version: 4.x

### What you did

```php
class FileStorageTestTable extends Table
{
    public function initialize(array $config): void
    {
        parent::initialize($config);
        $this->setTable('file_storage');
    }
}

$this->FileStorage = $this->getTableLocator()->get(FileStorageTestTable::class);
$this->FileStorage->get('uuid');
```

### What happened

```
1) Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageBehaviorTest::testAfterDelete
PDOException: SQLSTATE[HY000]: General error: 1 unrecognized token: "\"
```

The reason is that the class name is used.

```sh
########## DEBUG ##########
'SELECT Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.id AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__id, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.user_id AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__user_id, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.foreign_key AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__foreign_key, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.model AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__model, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.filename AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__filename, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.path AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__path, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.adapter AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__adapter, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.created AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__created, Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.modified AS Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable__modified FROM file_storage Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable WHERE Burzum\FileStorage\Test\TestCase\Model\Behavior\FileStorageTestTable.id = :c0 LIMIT 1'
```

### What you expected to happen

Simply no error or a **meaningful** exception message.

I'm not sure but maybe it is possible to detect this case somehow by checking if alias is set and a class name is used something like  this pseudo code `if alias === null && class_exists($name)` then either set an alias based on something or throw at least an exception that tells me about the cause and tells me to set an alias.
